params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel containing the message to be deleted.

params.name: ts
params.description: Timestamp of the message to be deleted.

params.name: as_user
params.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with chat:write:user scope. Bot users in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with chat:write:bot scope.

errors.name: message_not_found
errors.description: No message exists with the requested timestamp.

errors.name: channel_not_found
errors.description: Value passed for channel was invalid.

errors.name: cant_delete_message
errors.description: Authenticated user does not have permission to delete this message.

errors.name: compliance_exports_prevent_deletion
errors.description: Compliance exports are on, messages can not be deleted

errors.name: external_channel_migrating [hidden]
errors.description: Channel is undergoing active migration

errors.name: delete_failed [hidden]
errors.description: delete failed (generated)

errors.name: broadcast_delete_fail [hidden]
errors.description: broadcast delete fail (generated)

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.name: account_inactive
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.name: org_login_required
errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.

errors.name: ekm_access_denied
errors.description: Administrators have suspended the ability to post a message.

errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific scope permissions required to complete this request.

errors.name: not_allowed_token_type
errors.description: The token type used in this request is not allowed.

errors.name: team_access_not_granted
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific workspace access required to complete this request.

This includes very long names and names with non-alphanumeric characters other than _. If you get this error, it is typically an indication that you have made a very malformed API call.

params.description: The channel the scheduled_message is posting to

params.description: scheduled_message_id returned from call to chat.scheduleMessage

params.name: as_user
params.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with chat:write:user scope. Bot users in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with chat:write:bot scope.

methods.name: chat.postEphemeral
methods.description: Sends an ephemeral message to a user in a channel.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

params.name: text
params.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

params.name: user
params.description: id of the user who will receive the ephemeral message. The user should be in the channel specified by the channel argument.

params.name: as_user
params.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user. Defaults to true if the chat:write:bot scope is not included. Otherwise, defaults to false.

params.name: attachments
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

params.name: blocks
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

params.name: icon_emoji
params.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

params.name: icon_url
params.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

params.name: link_names
params.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

params.name: parse
params.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to none. See below.

params.name: thread_ts
params.description: Provide another message's ts value to post this message in a thread. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent's value instead. Ephemeral messages in threads are only shown if there is already an active thread.

params.name: username
params.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

errors.name: restricted_action
errors.description: A workspace preference prevents the authenticated user from posting.

errors.name: too_many_attachments
errors.description: Too many attachments were provided with this message. A maximum of 100 attachments are allowed on a message.

errors.name: is_archived
errors.description: Channel has been archived.

errors.name: channel_not_found
errors.description: Value passed for channel was invalid.

errors.name: msg_too_long
errors.description: Message text is too long

errors.name: no_text
errors.description: No message text provided

errors.name: user_not_in_channel
errors.description: Intended recipient is not in the specified channel.

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

methods.name: chat.postMessage
methods.description: Sends a message to a channel.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See below for more details.

params.name: as_user
params.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See authorship below.

params.name: attachments
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

params.name: blocks
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

params.name: draft_id
params.description: The id of the draft associated with the message

params.name: icon_emoji
params.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

params.name: icon_url
params.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

params.name: link_names
params.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

params.name: mrkdwn
params.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to false. Enabled by default.Default: true

params.name: parse
params.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to none. See below.

params.name: reply_broadcast
params.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

params.name: text
params.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

params.name: thread_ts
params.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

params.name: unfurl_links
params.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

params.name: unfurl_media
params.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

params.name: username
params.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with as_user set to false, otherwise ignored. See authorship below.

errors.name: channel_not_found
errors.description: Value passed for channel was invalid.

errors.name: duplicate_channel_not_found
errors.description: Channel associated with client_msg_id was invalid.

errors.name: duplicate_message_not_found
errors.description: No duplicate message exists associated with client_msg_id.

errors.name: not_in_channel
errors.description: Cannot post user messages to a channel they are not in.

errors.name: is_archived
errors.description: Channel has been archived.

errors.name: msg_too_long
errors.description: Message text is too long

errors.name: no_text
errors.description: No message text provided

errors.name: restricted_action
errors.description: A workspace preference prevents the authenticated user from posting.

errors.name: restricted_action_read_only_channel
errors.description: Cannot post any message into a read-only channel.

errors.name: restricted_action_thread_only_channel
errors.description: Cannot post top-level messages into a thread-only channel.

errors.name: restricted_action_non_threadable_channel
errors.description: Cannot post thread replies into a non_threadable channel.

errors.name: restricted_action_thread_locked
errors.description: Cannot post replies to a thread that has been locked by admins.

errors.name: too_many_attachments
errors.description: Too many attachments were provided with this message. A maximum of 100 attachments are allowed on a message.

errors.name: too_many_contact_cards
errors.description: Too many contact_cards were provided with this message. A maximum of 10 contact cards are allowed on a message.

errors.name: rate_limited
errors.description: Application has posted too many messages, read the Rate Limit documentation for more information

errors.name: as_user_not_supported
errors.description: The as_user parameter does not function with workspace apps.

errors.name: ekm_access_denied
errors.description: Administrators have suspended the ability to post a message.

methods.name: chat.scheduleMessage
methods.description: Schedules a message to be sent to a channel.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel, private group, or DM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See below for more details.

params.name: post_at
params.description: Unix EPOCH timestamp of time in future to send the message.

params.name: text
params.description: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

params.name: as_user
params.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See chat.postMessage.

params.name: attachments
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

params.name: blocks
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

params.name: link_names
params.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

params.name: parse
params.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to none. See chat.postMessage.

params.name: reply_broadcast
params.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

params.name: thread_ts
params.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

params.name: unfurl_links
params.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

params.name: unfurl_media
params.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

errors.name: invalid_time
errors.description: value passed for post_time was invalid.

errors.description: value passed for post_time was in the past.

errors.name: time_too_far
errors.description: value passed for post_time was too far into the future.

errors.description: Value passed for channel was invalid.

methods.name: chat.unfurl
methods.description: Provide custom unfurl behavior for user-posted URLs

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel ID of the message

params.name: ts
params.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to.

params.name: unfurls
params.description: URL-encoded JSON map with keys set to URLs featured in the the message, pointing to their unfurl blocks or message attachments.

params.name: user_auth_blocks
params.description: Provide a JSON based array of structured blocks presented as URL-encoded string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior

params.name: user_auth_message
params.description: Provide a simply-formatted string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior. Provides two buttons, Not now or Never ask me again.

params.name: user_auth_required
params.description: Set to true or 1 to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domainDefault: 0

params.name: user_auth_url
params.description: Send users to this custom URL where they will complete authentication in your app to fully trigger unfurling. Value should be properly URL-encoded.

errors.name: missing_channel
errors.description: The request is missing the channel parameter

errors.name: missing_ts
errors.description: The request is missing the ts parameter

errors.name: cannot_find_channel
errors.description: The specified channel could not be located for this token.

errors.name: cannot_find_service
errors.description: A record of your app being allowed to unfurl for this workspace could not be found.

errors.description: The provided unfurls argument could not be parsed or understood.

errors.name: invalid_unfurls_format
errors.description: The unfurls parameter cannot be JSON-decoded into a map of URLs to attachments.

errors.name: cannot_unfurl_url
errors.description: The URL cannot be unfurled. This error may be returned if you haven't acknowledged a link_shared event tied to the same URL. It is also returned when the domain appears in a workspace's administrative blocklists.

errors.name: cannot_prompt
errors.description: The current user has already interacted with and dismissed a prompt for this application.

errors.name: cannot_find_message
errors.description: The ts value in the request does not match a message.

errors.name: cannot_unfurl_message
errors.description: The URL cannot be unfurled because the URL provided does not appear in the message.

errors.description: The current user cannot be authenticated.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

params.name: ts
params.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

params.name: as_user
params.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. Bot users in this context are considered authed users.

params.name: attachments
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string. This field is required when not presenting text. If you don't include this field, the message's previous attachments will be retained. To remove previous attachments, include an empty array for this field.

params.name: blocks
params.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string. If you don't include this field, the message's previous blocks will be retained. To remove previous blocks, include an empty array for this field.

params.name: link_names
params.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to none. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, none.

params.name: parse
params.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to client, unlike chat.postMessage. Accepts either none or full. If you do not specify a value for this field, the original value set for the message will be overwritten with the default, client.

params.name: reply_broadcast
params.description: Broadcast an existing thread reply to make it visible to everyone in the channel or conversation.Default: false

params.name: text
params.description: New text for the message, using the default formatting rules. It's not required when presenting blocks or attachments.

errors.name: message_not_found
errors.description: No message exists with the requested timestamp.

errors.name: cant_update_message
errors.description: Authenticated user does not have permission to update this message.

errors.name: cant_broadcast_message
errors.description: Unable to broadcast this message.

errors.name: update_failed
errors.description: Internal update failure.

errors.name: channel_not_found
errors.description: Value passed for channel was invalid.

errors.name: team_not_found
errors.description: Team associated with the message and channel could not be found.

errors.name: edit_window_closed
errors.description: The message cannot be edited due to the team message edit settings

errors.name: msg_too_long
errors.description: Message text is too long

errors.name: too_many_attachments
errors.description: Too many attachments were provided with this message. A maximum of 100 attachments are allowed on a message.

errors.name: no_dual_broadcast_content_update
errors.description: Can't broadcast an old reply and update the content at the same time.

errors.name: no_text
errors.description: No message text provided

errors.name: as_user_not_supported
errors.description: The as_user parameter does not function with workspace apps.

errors.name: is_inactive
errors.description: The message cannot be edited within a frozen, archived or deleted channel.

errors.name: invalid_blocks
errors.description: The blocks were invalid for the requesting user.

errors.name: invalid_attachments
errors.description: The attachments were invalid.

errors.name: external_channel_migrating
errors.description: The channel is in the process of migrating and so the message cannot be updated at this time.

errors.name: slack_connect_file_link_sharing_blocked
errors.description: Admin has disabled Slack File sharing in all Slack Connect communications

errors.name: metadata_too_large [hidden]
errors.description: Metadata exceeds size limit

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.name: account_inactive
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.name: org_login_required
errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.

errors.name: ekm_access_denied
errors.description: Administrators have suspended the ability to post a message.

errors.name: missing_scope
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific scope permissions required to complete this request.

errors.name: not_allowed_token_type
errors.description: The token type used in this request is not allowed.

errors.name: method_deprecated
errors.description: The method has been deprecated.

errors.name: deprecated_endpoint
errors.description: The endpoint has been deprecated.

errors.name: two_factor_setup_required
errors.description: Two factor setup is required.

errors.name: enterprise_is_restricted
errors.description: The method cannot be called from an Enterprise.

errors.name: team_access_not_granted
errors.description: The token used is not granted the specific workspace access required to complete this request.

errors.name: invalid_arguments
errors.description: The method was either called with invalid arguments or some detail about the arguments passed are invalid, which is more likely when using complex arguments like blocks or attachments.

errors.name: invalid_arg_name
errors.description: The method was passed an argument whose name falls outside the bounds of accepted or expected values. This includes very long names and names with non-alphanumeric characters other than _. If you get this error, it is typically an indication that you have made a very malformed API call.

errors.name: invalid_array_arg
errors.description: The method was passed an array as an argument. Please only input valid strings.

errors.name: invalid_charset
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request, but the charset specified in the Content-Type header was invalid. Valid charset names are: utf-8 iso-8859-1.

errors.name: invalid_form_data
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request with Content-Type application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data, but the form data was either missing or syntactically invalid.

errors.name: invalid_post_type
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request, but the specified Content-Type was invalid. Valid types are: application/json application/x-www-form-urlencoded multipart/form-data text/plain.

errors.name: missing_post_type
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request and included a data payload, but the request did not include a Content-Type header.

errors.name: team_added_to_org
errors.description: The workspace associated with your request is currently undergoing migration to an Enterprise Organization. Web API and other platform operations will be intermittently unavailable until the transition is complete.

errors.name: invalid_json [hidden]
errors.description: The method was called via a `POST` request with `Content-Type` `application/json`, but the body was not valid JSON.

errors.name: json_not_object [hidden]
errors.description: The method was called via a `POST` request a valid JSON body, but the JSON value was not an object.

errors.name: ratelimited
errors.description: The request has been ratelimited. Refer to the Retry-After header for when to retry the request.

errors.name: accesslimited
errors.description: Access to this method is limited on the current network

errors.name: request_timeout
errors.description: The method was called via a POST request, but the POST data was either missing or truncated.

errors.name: upgrade_required [hidden]
errors.description: The calling application needs to be upgraded.

errors.name: service_unavailable
errors.description: The service is temporarily unavailable

errors.name: fatal_error
errors.description: The server could not complete your operation(s) without encountering a catastrophic error. It's possible some aspect of the operation succeeded before the error was raised.

errors.name: internal_error
errors.description: The server could not complete your operation(s) without encountering an error, likely due to a transient issue on our end. It's possible some aspect of the operation succeeded before the error was raised.

methods.name: chat.scheduledMessages.list
methods.description: Returns a list of scheduled messages.

params.name: token
params.description: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel of the scheduled messages

params.name: cursor
params.description: For pagination purposes, this is the cursor value returned from a previous call to chat.scheduledmessages.list indicating where you want to start this call from.

params.name: latest
params.description: A UNIX timestamp of the latest value in the time range

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum number of original entries to return.

params.name: oldest
params.description: A UNIX timestamp of the oldest value in the time range

params.name: team_id
params.description: encoded team id to list channels in, required if org token is used

errors.name: invalid_channel
errors.description: The channel passed is invalid

errors.name: invalid_ts_latest [hidden]
errors.description: invalid ts latest (generated)

errors.name: invalid_token
errors.description: Token is invalid

errors.name: invalid_cursor
errors.description: Provided cursor is invalid

errors.name: not_authed
errors.description: No authentication token provided.

errors.name: invalid_auth
errors.description: Some aspect of authentication cannot be validated. Either the provided token is invalid or the request originates from an IP address disallowed from making the request.

errors.name: account_inactive
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace when using a bot token.

errors.name: token_revoked
errors.description: Authentication token is for a deleted user or workspace or the app has been removed when using a user token.

errors.name: no_permission
errors.description: The workspace token used in this request does not have the permissions necessary to complete the request. Make sure your app is a member of the conversation it's attempting to post a message to.

errors.name: org_login_required
errors.description: The workspace is undergoing an enterprise migration and will not be available until migration is complete.
